intro: Legousia scabra, commonly known as the rough legousia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
